recipes.name: Tamarind Rice
recipes.description: A tangy and flavorful South Indian rice dish made with tamarind extract and aromatic spices.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add chana dal, urad dal, red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add turmeric powder and tamarind paste. Cook until oil separates.
Add salt and mix the paste with cooked rice.
Serve warm.
recipes.memory: Mom used to pack this for school lunch on rainy days—it always tasted better than anything in the cafeteria.

recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.description: A rich and creamy North Indian curry made with paneer cubes simmered in a buttery tomato sauce.
instructions: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger garlic paste and sauté until raw smell goes.
Add tomato puree, chili powder, garam masala, and cook until oil separates.
Add cream and paneer cubes. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.
recipes.memory: The first dish I learned from mom during summer vacation—we laughed so much when I almost burnt the butter.

recipes.name: Chicken Pulao
recipes.description: A mildly spiced rice dish cooked with tender chicken and aromatic whole spices.
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes.
In a pressure cooker, heat oil and add whole spices.
Add onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger garlic paste and sauté.
Add chicken, tomatoes, garam masala, and salt. Cook until chicken is half done.
Add soaked rice and water. Pressure cook for 2 whistles.
Fluff and serve hot.
recipes.memory: Mom used to make this every Sunday—it was the smell that got me running to the kitchen.

recipes.name: Sabudana Kheer
recipes.description: A creamy Indian dessert made with tapioca pearls, milk, and sugar, often enjoyed during festivals.
instructions: Soak sabudana for 2 hours.
Boil milk and add soaked sabudana.
Cook until pearls turn translucent and kheer thickens.
Add sugar and cardamom powder. Stir well.
Fry cashews and raisins in ghee and add to kheer.
Serve warm or chilled.
recipes.memory: She made this every year for Shivratri—watching the pearls dance in the milk always felt magical.

recipes.name: Idli and Chutney
recipes.description: A classic South Indian breakfast combo of soft steamed rice cakes and coconut chutney.
instructions: Pour batter into idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Grind coconut, chana dal, chili, ginger, and salt to make chutney.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, and pour over chutney.
Serve idlis with the chutney on the side.
recipes.memory: Our Sunday breakfast ritual—mom would hum her favorite tunes while making these soft, fluffy idlis.
